{"step_by_step_thinking": "The temporomandibular ligament, also known as the external lateral ligament, connects the lower articular tubercle of the zygomatic arch to the lateral and posterior border of the neck of the mandible as per Document [5]. The mandibular condyle is part of the mandible, and the temporomandibular ligament is attached to the lateral and posterior border of the neck of the mandible. Therefore, the temporomandibular ligament is attached to the mandibular condyle.", "answer_choice": "C. Mandibular condyle"}
